aws::graph::propositions: # Amazon Cybersecurity Governance and Risk Management
Amazon engages in-house cybersecurity capabilities to manage cybersecurity risks.
Amazon engages external assessors to assist with assessing cybersecurity risks.
Amazon engages external consultants to assist with identifying cybersecurity risks.
Amazon engages external auditors to assist with managing cybersecurity risks.
Amazon engages other third parties to assist with cybersecurity risk management.
Amazon's senior leadership evaluates cybersecurity risks.
Amazon's senior leadership evaluates cybersecurity mitigations.
Cybersecurity risks are part of Amazon's enterprise risk assessments.
The Audit Committee of Amazon's Board of Directors reviews enterprise risk assessments.
Amazon's Board of Directors reviews enterprise risk assessments.
Cybersecurity risks and mitigations are subject to oversight by the Security Committee of Amazon's Board of Directors.
Additional information about cybersecurity risks Amazon faces is discussed in Item 1A of Part I, "Risk Factors."
The cybersecurity risks are discussed under the heading "We Could Be Harmed by Data Loss or Other Security Incidents."
The information under "We Could Be Harmed by Data Loss or Other Security Incidents" should be read in conjunction with the information about cybersecurity governance.
The Security Committee is comprised of independent directors.
The Security Committee oversees Amazon's policies for protecting Amazon's cybersecurity infrastructure.
The Security Committee oversees Amazon's procedures for protecting Amazon's cybersecurity infrastructure.
The Security Committee oversees Amazon's compliance with applicable data protection regulations.
The Security Committee oversees Amazon's compliance with security regulations.
The Security Committee oversees related risks to data protection and security.
The Security Committee receives reports regarding cybersecurity risks from management.
The Security Committee receives reports from Amazon's chief security officer.
The Security Committee reports to the Board of Directors at least annually.

text:
In addition to our extensive in-house cybersecurity capabilities, at times we also engage assessors, consultants, auditors, or other third parties to assist with assessing, identifying, and managing cybersecurity risks.

Our cybersecurity risks and associated mitigations are evaluated by senior leadership, including as part of our enterprise risk assessments that are reviewed by the Audit Committee and our Board of Directors. Such risks and mitigations are also subject to oversight by the Security Committee of our Board of Directors. Additional information about cybersecurity risks we face is discussed in Item 1A of Part I, Risk Factors, under the heading We Could Be Harmed by Data Loss or Other Security Incidents, which should be read in conjunction with the information above.

The Security Committee, which is comprised of independent directors, oversees our policies and procedures for protecting our cybersecurity infrastructure and for compliance with applicable data protection and security regulations, and related risks. The Security Committee receives reports regarding such risks from management, including our chief security officer, and reports to the Board at least annually.
